org.mellowtech.core.bytestorable

Class CBByteArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mellowtech.core.bytestorable.BStorableImp<byte[],CBByteArray>
      • org.mellowtech.core.bytestorable.CBByteArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<CBByteArray>, BComparable<byte[],CBByteArray>, BStorable<byte[],CBByteArray>

    public class CBByteArray
extends BStorableImp<byte[],CBByteArray>
implements BComparable<byte[],CBByteArray>
    Implements a byte array (byte[]) as a ByteStorable for easy storage and retrieval of byte arrays.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.mellowtech.core.bytestorable.BStorableImp

        value

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CBByteArray()
      Empty constructor.
      CBByteArray(byte[] byteArray)
      Creates a new CBByteArray which points to the supplied array.
      CBByteArray(byte[] byteArray, int offset, int length)
      Creates a new CBByteArray with initial contents, a new internal byte array is created if offset != 0 and length != byteArray.length, otherwise the internal byte array points to the supplied byte array.

                   int offset,

        length - the length

      • byteCompare

        public int byteCompare(int offset1,
                       byte[] b1,
                       int offset2,
                       byte[] b2)
        Description copied from interface: BComparable
        Compares two objects that are represented as bytes in a byte arrays. Default implementation wraps the byte arrays to ByteBuffers and calls byteCompare(offset1, ByteBuffer.wrap(b1), offset2, ByteBuffer.wrap(b2)
        Specified by:
        byteCompare in interface BComparable<byte[],CBByteArray>
        Parameters:
        offset1 - the offset in the buffer for the first object
        b1 - array that holds the first object
        offset2 - the offset in the buffer for the second object
        b2 - array that holds the second object
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first argument is less than, equal to, or greater than the second.

      • byteCompare

        public int byteCompare(int offset1,
                       ByteBuffer bb1,
                       int offset2,
                       ByteBuffer bb2)
        Description copied from interface: BComparable
        Compares two objects that are represented as bytes in a ByteBuffers. Default implementation reads the objects and call their compareTo method. Subclasses should override
        Specified by:
        byteCompare in interface BComparable<byte[],CBByteArray>
        Parameters:
        offset1 - the offset in the buffer for the first object
        bb1 - buffer for the first object
        offset2 - the offset in the buffer for the second object
        bb2 - buffer for the second object
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first argument is less than, equal to, or greater than the second.
